akas: Escândalos: Os Bastidores do Poder Brazil
The Fixer South Africa (English title) (alternative title)
akas from release info: Escândalos: Os Bastidores do Poder Brazil
The Fixer South Africa (English title) (alternative title)

1.title: Watch Me
1.plot: Liv has taken over the white house but can't deal with being B613's command.

2.title: Pressing the Flesh
2.plot: President Grant tries to start a peace process in Middle East hosting a state dinner for president Rashad of Bashran. Anyway Olivia is secretly thinking about a back-up plan. Meanwhile QP&A is trying to gain more clientele.

3.title: Day 101
3.plot: Fitzergerald Grant is the focus of this episode and his life since handing in his presidency.

4.title: Lost Girls
4.plot: While Liv is busy running the free world, the team at QPA works with an unexpected client to solve an important case. At the White House, Mellie prepares for the upcoming nuclear summit with President Rashad and Prime Minister Nazari.

5.title: Adventures in Babysitting
5.plot: Olivia and Mellie assert their power like never before. Meanwhile, Cyrus works on congressional approval to declare war in Bashran, and QPA keeps close watch on President Rashad's niece.

6.title: Vampires and Bloodsuckers
6.plot: The Gladiators come together to celebrate Quinn and Charlie's big day. Back at the White House, Cyrus, Mellie, and Jake deal with a new crisis in the Middle East.

8.title: Robin
8.plot: The aftermath of Quinn's kidnapping affects all of her loved ones, including Olivia.

9.title: Good People
9.plot: The events that occurred between Quinn's kidnapping and the gunshot that rocked Olivia to her core are revealed.

10.title: The People v. Olivia Pope
10.plot: Olivia agrees to join Fitz in Vermont where she discovers that her closest friends have orchestrated a relentless intervention.

11.title: Army of One
11.plot: Mellie's plans to name Jake as her new chief of staff only propels Olivia to do whatever it takes to make sure that does not happen. Back at Papa Pope's house, Quinn becomes restless, wondering just how long Rowan intends to keep her and Robin hidden from the outside world. Meanwhile at QPA, Abby, Huck and Charlie decide that it's time to move forward with new clients when their first case leads to surprising intel.

12.title: Allow Me to Reintroduce Myself
12.plot: Annalise Keating seeks Olivia's help in fast-tracking a judicial reform class action to the United States Supreme Court.

13.title: Air Force Two
13.plot: When a hacker hijacks the Air Force Two plane with Cyrus and David on board, they must prepare for the worst in what might be the last minutes of their life.

14.title: The List
14.plot: Liv goes to the team for help in finding out if Cyrus helped hijack Air Force 2. A young intern goes missing after her name appears on a list of women who will do things to get a job on the hill.

15.title: The Noise
15.plot: When Charlie is taken into custody for the hijacking of Air Force Two, Quinn is faced with an important choice. Meanwhile, Cyrus is pulling the strings behind closed doors and sets out to recruit Jake to join him on his quest for the White House.

16.title: People Like Me
16.plot: On the heels of her commitment to turn over a new leaf, personal turmoil strikes Olivia once again when Mellie demands that she get rid of Cyrus.

17.title: Standing in the Sun
17.plot: Cyrus and Jake's mission to take the White House reaches a new level of deceit when Liv is called to testify against Mellie.

18.title: Over a Cliff
18.plot: With the existence of B613 exposed to the world, Olivia Pope and her Gladiators make the ultimate sacrifice in order to take down Cyrus and Jake-but how far will they go to get justice?

1.title: Sweet Baby
1.plot: Olivia hires Quinn, who must deal with a woman's accusation against the President; Pope & Associates must prove a decorated war veteran innocent of murder.

2.title: Dirty Little Secrets
2.plot: Olivia and her team must keep a DC Madam's client list under wraps; Quinn continues to deal with the President's former intern.

3.title: Hell Hath No Fury
3.plot: A millionaire's son is accused of rape; Olivia must deal with Amanda's first request as a client, a meeting with the President.

4.title: Enemy of the State
4.plot: Olivia and Cyrus get into a heated argument about the Amanda Tanner case; Quinn helps a dictator locate his allegedly kidnapped wife and children, going out with a reporter to seek information.

5.title: Crash and Burn
5.plot: After a commercial plane crash, Olivia and her team must defend the pilot from the media and airline accusations; When Amanda goes missing, Huck calls upon his dark past; Fitz seeks help from the Vice President.

6.title: The Trail
6.plot: As Gideon looks into Amanda's past, a series of events from the past are revisited.

7.title: Grant: For the People
7.plot: Quinn finds herself in a tragic situation; Billy makes an announcement that shakes Fitz's presidency to its core.

1.title: White Hats Off
1.plot: Information about Quinn's real identity and past is revealed.

2.title: The Other Woman
2.plot: Olivia and her team must do some heavy lifting -- literally.

3.title: Hunting Season
3.plot: A government employee shocks Olivia by revealing how high the scandal goes.

4.title: Beltway Unbuckled
4.plot: Olivia is asked by Senator Davis to help locate a missing girl because her parents are his constituents. They find her, she appears to have been the victim of a hit and run. They find the person who struck her, only problem is that the man is a diplomat who has diplomatic immunity. Olivia goes to see the President to ask him to have the man's immunity lifted. But he refuses to do anything. Olivia is then called by someone from the White House who offers to help her. David continues to investigate why Quinn's case was derailed and discovers someone powerful.

5.title: All Roads Lead to Fitz
5.plot: A governor takes the law into his own hands when his wife is raped.

6.title: Spies Like Us
6.plot: Olivia receives a coded warning that could expose Huck's past.

7.title: Defiance
7.plot: The team manages a billionaire who seems to have lost his sanity.

8.title: Happy Birthday, Mr. President
8.plot: The President's shot upon arriving at what is suppose to be his birthday party. Olivia who's there, goes to the hospital. And she recalls moments from her days in the White House. The Vice President tries assume the duties of the President so Cyrus asks for Olivia's help.

10.title: One for the Dog
10.plot: Olivia and Cyrus gets word that Fitz is awake. So they go to the hospital and see he's still in a coma. Mellie was the one who spread the word that Fitz is awake to stop Hollis and Langston from making a move on the Presidency. So they try to keep the thing a secret. David is present when Huck who is being held under the Patriot Act and being tortured. When he learns the President is still alive he tells David the President is still in danger. So David goes to Olivia to try and get Huck released. She does and she asks him to help find the one who tried to kill the ...

11.title: A Criminal, a Whore, an Idiot and a Liar
11.plot: Fitz calls a press conference to show that he is able to return to his duties. And we take a look at when during his campaign, when everyone (Cyrus, Mellie and Olivia) were concerned that he was down in the polls. They want to bring in Fitz's father but Fitz hates the man but Olivia convinces him to bring him in. And we see how Olvia brought Harrison, Huck and Abby to work with her.

12.title: Truth or Consequences
12.plot: Mellie tries to reel in Fitz, and flashbacks show the events leading up to what happened to Quinn, when she was formerly Lindsey Dwyer.

13.title: Nobody Likes Babies
13.plot: David learns the truth about the Cytron case; Things come to a head for Pope & Associates, with extreme measures to protect themselves and those they love.

14.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot
14.plot: Cyrus is going to christen his baby and asks Olivia and Fitz to be god parents. David wakes up and finds himself with a woman he met, who is dead. so he calls Olivia and they first try to find out who she is and they learn that she may have been sent to get info from David. And David is still upset with Olivia for costing him his job. And Fitz is dealing with some Americans who are being held so he decides whether or not to mount a rescue operation. And chooses not to tell those involved or aware of the rigged election that he knows. And when he does order a rescue, ...

15.title: Boom Goes the Dynamite
15.plot: Olivia is tasked with finding a woman for a Goburnatorial candidate who is rumored to be gay by his family. Fitz wants to rescue the hostages but he has to find out who the leak is. Cyrus and Mellie who feel as if Fitz is shutting them out tries to show the other up. And Olivia is seeing Jake socially. and it turns out that Jake was tasked with keeping an eye on Olivia by Fitz. David thinks someone is following him so he turns to Olivia. They later learn that he is being followed by someone who knows the girl whom he is being framed for killing. And she claims to know...

16.title: Top of the Hour
16.plot: When the press learns that a man, whom the White House is considering supporting for the Supreme court, had an affair with one of his students years ago, who is now the CEO of a corporation. They camp out in front of the woman's house. Her lawyer sends Olivia to help her. Olivia starts by finding out if the affair is true. And when she says it is, Olivia advises her to be honest. But Cyrus wants to protect the man so he tells Oliva to tell her to deny but she's going to admit it. So Cyrus decides to smear her by making her appear to be a hussy. Olivis counters it. But...

17.title: Snake in the Garden
17.plot: Osborne, upon learning that Olivia's people are following him, goes to Olivia to find out why. Eventually Fitz learns that he's the mole but he denies it. Hollis Doyle goes to Olivia and shows her a video of his daughter being held captive and saying, that if her father wants to see her, to send 20 million dollars. But Hollis says that his daughter has always been a problem child and this could just be an act. When her ear arrives, they wonder if it's true or not.

18.title: Molly, You in Danger, Girl
18.plot: After Osborne's suicide everyone thinks it was out of guilt that he was going to be outed as a traitor. The President then goes on TV to say that. But his wife goes to Olivia saying he didn't commit suicide and Olivia believes her. They discover that they were wrong about Osborne so they decide to look into things again. First they need to talk to Molly who was the one who pointed the finger at Osborne. But she's vanished.

19.title: Seven Fifty-Two
19.plot: While Olivia is unconscious in the hospital, Fitz goes and stands by her bedside. Huck has a breakdown after being locked up. He then recalls how he became who he is and how he met Liv.

20.title: A Woman Scorned
20.plot: Mellie has secretly moved into the Blair House and is threatening to reveal his infidelities unless he promises to be loyal to her. And he thinks she's bluffing while Cyrus says they should be worried. He tries to talk to Mellie but she stands her ground. Olivia's people learn that it was Charlie who attacked Huck at the storage facility and broke into Olivia's. Which makes them think Cyrus is the mole which Olivia doesn't believe. So they try to find him.

21.title: Any Questions?
21.plot: Cyrus is at the center of a big scandal at the White House

22.title: White Hat's Back On
22.plot: As they get closer to uncovering the mole's identity, Olivia and her team find themselves in an increasingly dangerous situation.

1.title: It's Handled
1.plot: Olivia learns what her father is capable of.

2.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
2.plot: Flashbacks reveal more about Olivia's relationship with her father.

3.title: Mrs. Smith Goes to Washington
3.plot: Mellie and Fitz confess their true feelings. Olivia is caught in the White House as a hostage with a bomber.

4.title: Say Hello to My Little Friend
4.plot: Pope & Associates agree to work with a philandering senator.

5.title: More Cattle, Less Bull
5.plot: The team investigates Democratic Congresswoman Josie Marcus, while Olivia and Mellie have a surprising run-in during the White House Correspondents' Dinner. Meanwhile, Jake and Huck get closer to the truth about Operation Remington.

6.title: Icarus
6.plot: Olivia faces a decision that will affect her White House relationships; Harrison's loyalty is tested; Cyrus and Mellie scheme against Josie Marcus while the team works with her.

7.title: Everything's Coming Up Mellie
7.plot: In hope of recovering from public backlash, Mellie does a hard-hitting news interview; as Huck pushes Quinn away, her bloodlust threatens to put her in danger.

8.title: Vermont Is for Lovers, Too
8.plot: Olivia and the team must manage a potential crisis with the Josie Marcus campaign while investigating Operation Remington; Cyrus tries to take down Sally.

9.title: YOLO
9.plot: As the team gets closer to the truth, loyalties are tested and relationships are pushed to the limit. Meanwhile, Cyrus has to deal with his own crisis and he realizes that he may have gone too far.

10.title: A Door Marked Exit
10.plot: Everyone struggles to face the consequences of their actions now that the truth has been revealed.

11.title: Ride, Sally, Ride
11.plot: James tries to gather information about Sally murdering her husband, meanwhile rumors are going around about Fitz and Olivia having an affair.

12.title: We Do Not Touch the First Ladies
12.plot: Fitz faces a harsh reality when old feelings and jealousy arise at an event; Quinn wants to prove herself; Leo arranges a meeting between Sally and an old friend.

13.title: No Sun on the Horizon
13.plot: A well prepared Fitz gets thrown a curve ball during the first presidential debate, Olivia receives shocking news and is forced to make an extremely difficult decision, and the gladiators work with a powerful CEO accused of murder. Meanwhile, one dirty little secret could lead to deadly consequences.

14.title: Kiss Kiss Bang Bang
14.plot: Sally arranges a meeting with the NRA, sending the White House into a tailspin; Huck and Olivia come to startling realizations; a surprising person asks Pope and Associates for help.

15.title: Mama Said Knock You Out
15.plot: Fitz and Mellie's children prepare for an interview; Adnan seeks Harrison's help; Rowan warns Olivia to stop investigating B613.

16.title: The Fluffer
16.plot: Abby steps in as Olivia's proxy and takes on duties at the White House. Meanwhile, the team continues to investigate B613, and someone throws a wrench in Reston's presidential campaign.

17.title: Flesh and Blood
17.plot: The team must spring into action following a security breach; when Fitz's campaign stalls, he thinks about going against Olivia's suggestion; Maya and Adnan plan their next move.

18.title: The Price of Free and Fair Elections
18.plot: After Cyrus learns of Maya Pope's latest plan to kill President Grant, his hesitance turns the tide of the election.

1.title: Randy, Red, Superfreak and Julia
1.plot: Fitz begins his second term with a plan to make positive changes for the nation. Meanwhile, Mellie has trouble dealing with her son's death; and Olivia's absence leaves a void on her team.

2.title: The State of the Union
2.plot: In order for Fitz to make the biggest impact with his State of the Union address on gun control, Cyrus sets out to recruit a power couple who are influential on the issue. Meanwhile, Mellie's personal struggle gets national attention.

3.title: Inside the Bubble
3.plot: An old friend returns for help after her daughter goes missing, Cyrus has an awkward run in during a business breakfast, and Jake uses his connections to get some answers. Meanwhile, Mellie becomes obsessed with a national news story and David goes to great lengths to prove himself.

4.title: Like Father, Like Daughter
4.plot: Fitz asks Olivia to shut down a situation that could destroy the Grant family's reputation. Meanwhile, Huck and Quinn realize there is more than they originally thought when it comes to Catherine's case, and Rowan calls on an old friend to do his dirty work.

5.title: The Key
5.plot: Jake doesn't return Olivia's calls, which distracts her from Catherine's case. Elsewhere, Cyrus continues to get tangled up with Michael; David gets a taste of victory; and Fitz wants answers about Jerry's demise.

6.title: An Innocent Man
6.plot: Olivia is summoned by a convicted assassin who claims he was wrongly accused, and Mellie becomes intrigued by a former first lady whose stories seem to be strikingly similar to her own. Meanwhile, Elizabeth inches closer to corrupting the White House and Fitz makes a shocking move.

7.title: Baby Made a Mess
7.plot: Unable to believe Jake is guilty, Olivia seeks out Tom for more information; Huck plays with fire.

8.title: The Last Supper
8.plot: Fitz and Jake continue to fight over Olivia, but Olivia needs them to focus on the real prize, taking down Command. Meanwhile, Huck longs to connect with his family and Quinn continues tracking Kubiak. Back at the White House, Cyrus exploits finally catch up to him, but Elizabeth North's plan is much bigger than anyone ever expected.

9.title: Where the Sun Don't Shine
9.plot: Quinn and Huck uncover West Angola conspiracy, Jake goes after Rowan, Cyrus's explicit photos hit the internet and the President underestimated Andrew.

10.title: Run
10.plot: Olivia is kidnapped and held hostage in an unknown location.

11.title: Where's the Black Lady?
11.plot: Olivia is still missing and the team comes together to do whatever it takes to find her.

12.title: Gladiators Don't Run
12.plot: Olivia officially goes up for bidding.

13.title: No More Blood
13.plot: As the bidding for Olivia Pope continues, the gladiators fight to save her but The White House fears that they may lose her for good.

14.title: The Lawn Chair
14.plot: A tragedy in D.C. gains national attention and the White House must deal with their problematic VP.

15.title: The Testimony of Diego Muñoz
15.plot: David Rosen is caught off guard when a surprise visitor reveals insider information about B613 that could take down the White House and destroy Pope and Associates.

16.title: It's Good to Be Kink
16.plot: Olivia springs into action when she hears of a woman intending to expose sex secrets of some of DC's most elite. Meanwhile, Elizabeth fears that Mellie's sister could be detrimental to their political aspirations.

17.title: Put a Ring on It
17.plot: When Michael gets himself in a bad situation, the Gladiators launch into damage control and put pressure on Cyrus to move up the wedding. Meanwhile, David takes the first step in executing his plan to take down B613.

18.title: Honor Thy Father
18.plot: David tries to recruit former B613 agents to strengthen his case. Meanwhile, a congressman asks Olivia to help his father escape his looming death penalty.

19.title: I'm Just a Bill
19.plot: Rowan's return raises the stakes for those targeting B613; Fitz needs an important bill passed.

20.title: First Lady Sings the Blues
20.plot: Those trying to take down B613 must take drastic measures to ensure their safety; the nation turns against Mellie, forcing Cyrus to come to her defense.

21.title: A Few Good Women
21.plot: Vice President Ross continues to defy the Grant administration when she hires Olivia Pope to defend a woman in the Navy. Meanwhile, Quinn and Huck must do what they do best to get answers about B613 and Mellie's campaign for Senate continues to be a struggle.

22.title: You Can't Take Command
22.plot: Everything comes to a head in the shocking season finale when Olivia and the team finally make some big moves to take down Command, and Mellie's fate is sealed as the election results are announced.

1.title: Heavy Is the Head
1.plot: When the Royals visit the White House, President Fitz uses the opportunity to discuss foreign policy. But when a fatal accident causes a rift in the negotiations, it may cause a rift within Fitz and Olivia as well.

2.title: Yes
2.plot: A new case takes Olivia out of D.C. and away from Fitz; Abby receives unexpected guidance.

3.title: Paris Is Burning
3.plot: Olivia and Fitz face big consequences; Mellie enlists an old friend to ensure she gets her way.

4.title: Dog-Whistle Politics
4.plot: While the media storm around Olivia intensifies, Quinn & Huck bring in help to deal with it! Jake crosses paths with someone unexpected from his past.

5.title: You Got Served
5.plot: Senators Gibson and Moskowitz are moving forward with their plans to go after Fitz. And Olivia tries to handle things too, so she brings in Leo Bergen.

6.title: Get Out of Jail, Free
6.plot: An outrageous plan is presented to Fitz and Olivia, but it could solve their problems.

7.title: Even the Devil Deserves a Second Chance
7.plot: Fitz works on his comeback with the American public and uncovers something shocking in the process. Meanwhile, Olivia focuses on hiding her personal secrets instead of tending to a new client; and Elizabeth North develops a new agenda.

8.title: Rasputin
8.plot: In the midst of Fitz negotiating a historic peace deal, Olivia must rely on her instincts when a guest of the The White House discloses powerful intel.

9.title: Baby, It's Cold Outside
9.plot: Olivia feels more frustrated taking on "First Lady" type responsibilities; Mellie proves just how powerful she can be; Jake and Huck continue the hunt for Rowan.

10.title: It's Hard Out Here for a General
10.plot: Six months later from Fitz and Olivia's break-up they both try to handle their situation. Meanwhile, Pope and Associates take a new case that could lead to a national crisis.

11.title: The Candidate
11.plot: Mellie seeks out Olivia's help but may not be prepared for what it entails, and Liz tries to convince Susan Ross to run for the presidency. Meanwhile, Abby and Cyrus are at odds when a profile piece on Fitz comes into question.

12.title: Wild Card
12.plot: While Fitz is preoccupied with his own interests, Cyrus begins to orchestrate his next master plan, and Elizabeth North uses David to mastermind a plan of her own. Meanwhile, Olivia continues to question what exactly Jake is planning in his new role as head of the NSA.

13.title: The Fish Rots from the Head
13.plot: Olivia and the team take on some embattled Secret Service agents. Meanwhile, Abby has her hands full trying to keep Fitz in line, and Jake begins to reveal a few secrets of his own.

14.title: I See You
14.plot: Olivia continues to spy on Jake while the Gladiators have to fend for themselves. Meanwhile, Susan and Mellie feel the pressure as their campaigns heat up, and Abby begins to question Cyrus' motives.

15.title: Pencils Down
15.plot: After Mellie makes a public gaffe, Olivia tries to fix it; the Gladiators learn about Jake's new romance; David Rosen looks for advice on handling his love triangle with Liz North and Susan Ross.

16.title: The Miseducation of Susan Ross
16.plot: Following the first Republican debate, Olivia is presented with damaging information about an opponent and enlists the Gladiators to verify its authenticity. Meanwhile, David deals with fallout from his dating life, and Cyrus continues to work on his own political agenda.

17.title: Thwack!
17.plot: The election is in full swing, which means everyone is doing their best to take down their opponents, but when a potential leak threatens several candidates, they have to work together to keep their secrets safe. Boundaries are pushed and lines are crossed as we find out just how far some people are willing to go to protect themselves.

18.title: Till Death Do Us Part
18.plot: As Olivia deals with the aftermath of what she's done, she finally finds out what exactly Jake and Rowan are plotting. With their plans already in motion, Olivia is forced to try and stop it. Meanwhile, in flashbacks, we learn more about Jake's past and how he first got involved with B6-13.

19.title: Buckle Up
19.plot: A battle between Abby and Olivia threatens to keep Mellie and Susan from meeting Florida's governor.

20.title: Trump Card
20.plot: Olivia and Abby have to put their differences aside and work together to try and take Hollis Doyle down. Meanwhile, Edison realizes he may have made a deal with the devil as Rowan and Jake continue to try and pull the strings behind his campaign.

21.title: That's My Girl
21.plot: As each presidential candidate gets ready to announce their running mate, Olivia finds herself in a potentially dire situation. Meanwhile, Cyrus is presented with damaging information that could alter the presidential race entirely.

1.title: Survival of the Fittest
1.plot: The shocking results of the presidential race between Mellie Grant and Francisco Vargas set off an explosive outcome.

2.title: Hardball
2.plot: Flashbacks reveal how far Olivia was willing to go to win the election.

3.title: Fates Worse Than Death
3.plot: Cyrus seals his fate during a national crisis; Olivia and the gladiators do everything they can to find the truth.

4.title: The Belt
4.plot: Cyrus Beene has been convicted of the murder of President elect Frankie Vargas and is taken to jail. Huck has a new love interest. Abby & Fitz clash. Did Tom really shoot Frankie Vargas? Is Cyrus actually innocent? OPA investigate.

5.title: They All Bow Down
5.plot: Jake and Vanessa's messy relationship poses a threat to the campaign, forcing Olivia to take action. Meanwhile, a game-changing revelation about the conspiracy surrounding Francisco Vargas's assassination is revealed.

6.title: Extinction
6.plot: Rowan is caught by surprise when someone from his past resurfaces, and Olivia has to make a life-changing decision about the campaign. Meanwhile, flashbacks reveal exactly what happened the night of Francisco Vargas' assassination.

7.title: A Traitor Among Us
7.plot: Olivia makes a shocking decision when she finds new information about the assassination of Frankie Vargas.

8.title: A Stomach for Blood
8.plot: The events leading up to the election night, as seen from Abby's perspective reveal a thirst for power.

9.title: Dead in the Water
9.plot: It's a race against the clock when Olivia and OPA's investigation into the conspiracy puts one of their own in grave danger.

10.title: The Decision
10.plot: With the ugly truth behind Frankie's assassination revealed, a torn Olivia wonders how different her life - and the country - would be if she, Mellie, and Cyrus had never rigged Fitz's election.

11.title: Trojan Horse
11.plot: Olivia and the team are determined to bring down Peus, but as the Electoral College vote nears, the fight for power claims another victim.

12.title: Mercy
12.plot: Just when Peus' iron grip seem inescapable to Olivia and everyone she holds dear, a shocking threat to the White House turns everything on its head.

13.title: The Box
13.plot: As the future of the country hangs on the balance, Olivia and Fitz are at odds with Rowan, and Jake employs surprising tactics to manipulate the Mystery Woman.

14.title: Head Games
14.plot: While outgoing President Fitz considers his legacy, the Gladiators question what's next for OPA, and Jake finally discovers the motivation behind Peus's and the Mystery Woman's reign of terror.

15.title: Tick Tock
15.plot: As the clock ticks down to the inauguration of the first female President of the United States, Olivia takes a big risk to ensure Mellie's safety.

16.title: Transfer of Power
16.plot: In the final days of his presidency, Fitz uses his power to make some unexpected changes.

locations: The Huntington Library, Art Collections, and Botanical Gardens - 1151 Oxford Rd, San Marino, California, USA::(stand-in for White House exteriors)
Sunset Gower Studios - 1438 N. Gower Street, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA::(studio)
imdb.plot outline: When you get into trouble there's only one person to call, Olivia Pope. Olivia is a professional 'fixer' who makes problems go away before anyone even knows they exist. For the moneyed, the powerful and even the President, Olivia is a legend in her field. Her spectacular success is mostly due to her unbreakable rule of always trust your gut. No matter how careful you are, when you do damage control for a living, you're bound to cause some damage to your own life. She and her crew eat, sleep, live and breathe crisis. Each week, as the team races against the clock to defuse intriguing new problems before they become full-blown disasters, they also have to deal with their own personal issues. They may call themselves 'gladiators in suits', but little by little, Olivia and her crew begin to reveal the chinks in their armor.
imdb.title: Scandal
plot: A former White House Communications Director starts her own crisis management firm only to realize her clients are not the only ones with secrets.::Anonymous
